learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain why CFD is used to solve fluid dynamic problems.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain the advantages and limitations of CFD.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain spatial and temporal discretisation in a finite volume context.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain the operation of different boundary conditions.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain the principles behind numerical methods for solving incompressible flow problems.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain the principles behind numerical methods for solving compressible flow problems.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Explain turbulence modelling used for Reynolds Averaged Navier Stokes (RANS) simulations.
Demonstrate competence in numerical methods for fluid dynamic problems - Demonstrate familiarity with advanced CFD methods, such as LES, DNS, multi-phase VoF, dynamic meshes.
Create and alter CFD tools - Implement numerical methods for simulating flows in one- and two-dimensions, inviscid and viscous.
Create and alter CFD tools - Write and maintain source code for the simulation of flows.
Create and alter CFD tools - Create tools to automate pre- and post-processing of CFD results.
Create and alter CFD tools - Apply verification and validation techniques to assure the quality of numerical tools and solutions.
Apply CFD software - Construct meshes for CFD simulations.
Apply CFD software - Evaluate and improve mesh quality.
Apply CFD software - Apply generic principles of CFD when using a specific CFD package.
Apply CFD software - Demonstrate ability to select appropriate methods for fluid dynamics simulations.
Apply CFD software - Formulate solution approaches for compressible flow using a research CFD package, specifically Eilmer.
Evaluate numerical predictions - Appraise the quality of CFD meshes.
Evaluate numerical predictions - Apply numerical tools to estimate engineering quantities of interest.
Evaluate numerical predictions - Appraise the quality of CFD simulation results.
Evaluate numerical predictions - Use simulation results to create improved designs.

assessments.due_date: Homework exercises are due at 10:00am on Mondays in Weeks 2-13, excluding Week 5 because of the interruption to teaching due to the Exhibition holiday in Week 4. These Mondays are chosen to follow the previous week's tutorial on the Friday.
assessments.task_description:
The homework exercises for submission will be noted on the weekly tutorial worksheets. The submissions will take the form of computer source code, text responses and figures/graphs.

Each submission is worth 1%, but your total marks are capped at 10%. Your overall mark for homework exercises will be computed as the best 10 out of 11 submissions over the semester.

Â
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: This assignment will assess content in Modules 1 and 2 through implementation and application of a two-dimensional flow solver. The full assignment specification and criteria will be available on the Blackboard course page.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via Gradescope (with link provided on Blackboard).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This assignment will assess you ability to perform and interpret simulations of compressible flows. You will use the Eilmer compressible flow tool. The submission format is a short report. The full assignment specification will be released on the Blackboard course page.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam is a paper-based handwritten examination that assesses the concepts presented in all modules (1, 2 & 3) of the course.

The final exam is closed book.

Students are only permitted to use Casio FX82 series or UQ approved (labelled) calculators in this examination.

You will require 40% or higher in the final exam in order to get a grade of 4 or above in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 4(22 Jul - 18 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
MODULE 1: CFD in a microcosm

Introduction to CFD by building a simple one-d flow solver. This introduces: finite-volume method for Navier-Stokes equations; boundary conditions; discretisation; numerical stability; and measures of convergence.


Learning outcomes: L03, L04, L05, L10, L11, L12, L19, L20
learning_activities.topic_description: MODULE 1: CFD in a microcosm Introduction to CFD by building a simple one-d flow solver. This introduces: finite-volume method for Navier-Stokes equations; boundary conditions; discretisation; numerical stability; and measures of convergence.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(29 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

Tutorials: These sessions are structured around a worksheet and are self-paced. Staff may lead demonstrations on certain aspects of the worksheet exercises. Some of the worksheet exercises contribute towards the weekly homework assignments. In the weeks prior to major assignments, staff are available to give assignment advice in these sessions.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08, L09, L10, L11, L12, L13, L14, L15, L16, L17, L18, L19, L20
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials Tutorials: These sessions are structured around a worksheet and are self-paced. Staff may lead demonstrations on certain aspects of the worksheet exercises. Some of the worksheet exercises contribute towards the weekly homework assignments. In the weeks prior to major assignments, staff are available to give assignment advice in these sessions.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 5 To Week 8(19 Aug - 15 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
MODULE 2: D.I.Y Navier-Stokes solver

Learn about numerical algorithms for Euler and Navier-Stokes equations through a Do-It-Yourself approach: by building your own flow solver. Also covered in this module is grid generation, and verification and validation.


Learning outcomes: L06, L09, L10, L11, L12, L13, L16, L19, L20
learning_activities.topic_description: MODULE 2: D.I.Y Navier-Stokes solver Learn about numerical algorithms for Euler and Navier-Stokes equations through a Do-It-Yourself approach: by building your own flow solver. Also covered in this module is grid generation, and verification and validation.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Week 13(16 Sep - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
MODULE 3: Compressible Flow

Learn about solving compressible flows (Eilmer); Learn to write source code for compressible solvers


Learning outcomes: L06, L10, L11, L12, L13, L14, L15, L16, L17, L18, L19, L20, L21
learning_activities.topic_description: MODULE 3: Compressible Flow Learn about solving compressible flows (Eilmer); Learn to write source code for compressible solvers
